facts.fact: The Met’s Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History is a free scholarly resource that organizes art history by time and geography.
The British Museum provides an online collection search with object records and research information.
Tate hosts an online glossary explaining key art terms used in modern and contemporary art.
MoMA publishes research and exhibition materials through its online resources and publications pages.
Game Studies is a peer-reviewed, open-access journal dedicated to the study of games.
ToDIGRA (Transactions of the DiGRA) is an open-access, peer-reviewed journal for game research.
Leonardo (MIT Press) is a peer-reviewed journal at the intersection of art, science, and technology.
Oxford Art Journal is a leading peer-reviewed publication in art history and visual culture (Oxford University Press).
Praemium Imperiale is a major international arts prize awarded by the Japan Art Association across multiple disciplines.
The Turner Prize is one of the best-known contemporary art prizes in the United Kingdom, organized by Tate.
The V&A is a leading museum for art, design, and performance, with extensive online resources.
The Internet Archive hosts a large software collection, including preserved games and historical software.
The Video Game History Foundation supports game preservation and provides research resources and collections.
The Ashmolean Museum is often described as the world’s first university museum, part of the University of Oxford.
Harvard Art Museums provide collections, exhibitions, and research resources online.
